alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 17 at 7:03AM EST until December 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM CONTINUES TODAY... .A nor`easter continues to strengthen in the Gulf of Maine this morning. Moderate to occasionally heavy snowfall is still occurring across the western Maine mountains and foothills southwestward into the White Mountains. The highest snowfall totals are expected for these areas, though light to moderate snow will continue elsewhere through midday as precipitation slowly tapers off from south to north. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches for a storm total of 7 to 12 inches with locally up to 17 inches in the higher terrain. * WHERE...Belknap, Northern Grafton, Southern Carroll, and Southern Grafton Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate snow and low visibility will be the biggest hazards. Heavy, wet snow at times may lead to downed tree limbs, resulting in power outages.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
